intro: Descurainia rubescens, commonly known as scarlet flax, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and slightly hairy, with a distinctive reddish tinge when mature. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
